FuncDef:
The multicast shaping command sets an upper rate limit for multicast traffic on a specified board.
The undo multicast shaping command cancels the configuration.
By default, no upper rate limit is set for multicast traffic on a board.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an upper rate limit for multicast traffic on a specified board.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1000000, in Mbit/s.

ExtraInfo: To prevent multicast traffic bursts from resulting in multicast packet loss, run the multicast shaping command to set an upper rate limit for multicast traffic on a specified board. Therefore, when the rate of multicast traffic on the board exceeds the upper rate limit, the multicast traffic rate will be shaped to the value specified by .
